translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva realizes that all dharmas are originally empty in their intrinsic nature. In the emptiness of intrinsic nature, there is no one who reviles or praises, no one who harms or benefits, and no one who despises or respects.

original: 舍利子！

original: 「復次，舍利子！
analyzed: 「復次，舍利子！

translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva, by these causes and conditions, in the present life attains the protection and remembrance of all tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly enlightened ones in the ten directions, also attains the universal praise of the assembly of all bodhisattva-mahāsattvas in the ten directions, also attains the mutual respect and love of all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and those who cultivate the holy life, and is also worshipped, revered, respected, and praised by all the devas, humans, asuras, and so forth in the world.

translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva, by these causes and conditions, wherever he is born, his eyes always do not see unpleasant forms, his ears always do not hear unpleasant sounds, his nose always does not smell unpleasant smells, his tongue always does not taste unpleasant flavors, his body always does not experience unpleasant tactile objects, his mind always does not grasp unpleasant dharmas.

original: 舍利子！

translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva, by these causes and conditions, the merit he obtains increases more and more, up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, he is always irreversible.
